poem:
Dance Score  
  
Second place gleams—  
Montell and Jojo, twirling  
across the paper's lines,  
a soft brush of 8, 10, 9, 10  
lifts their footprints,  
Shirley's "bright" and Anton's  
"brilliant" stitched to shoes.  
The floor sways beneath  
whispers of Craig's critique—  
head poised, body  
breathing music, alive.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Strictly Come Dancing: week 10 – live 8.04pm GMT Judges’ scores for Montell and Jojo: 8, 10, 9, 10 for a total of 37 points. Second place with one dance to go. 8.02pm GMT Judges’ comments for Montell and Jojo: Shirley says “personality-plus, bright and much better body connection, quite delightful”. Anton says “improved, your best since that Couple’s Choice, absolutely brilliant”. Craig says “stiff beginning, head position a bit Death Becomes Her, dynamic and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
